
## Overview

Hexagonal puzzles create stunning honeycomb patterns. Each hexagonal piece connects to up to six neighbors through elegantly curved tabs. The result is a visually striking circular puzzle.

## Ring Variations

Hexagonal puzzles are defined by the number of rings:

```{r}
#| label: fig-hex-rings
#| layout-ncol: 3
#| fig-cap:
#|   - "2 rings (7 pieces)"
#|   - "3 rings (19 pieces)"
#|   - "4 rings (37 pieces)"

# 2 rings
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 2, seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()

# 3 rings
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 3, seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()

# 4 rings
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 4, seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()
```

## Piece Count Formula

The number of pieces in a hexagonal puzzle follows the formula:

$$n = 3r(r-1) + 1$$

Where $r$ is the number of rings.

| Rings | Pieces |
|-------|--------|
| 2 | 7 |
| 3 | 19 |
| 4 | 37 |
| 5 | 61 |
| 6 | 91 |

## Warp and Truncation

Hexagonal puzzles support two key transformations:

```{r}
#| label: fig-hex-warp-trunc
#| layout-ncol: 2
#| fig-cap:
#|   - "warp=TRUE, trunc=TRUE (Default)"
#|   - "warp=TRUE, trunc=FALSE"

# Default: warped and truncated
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 3,
    do_warp = TRUE, do_trunc = TRUE,
    seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "magma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()

# Warped but not truncated (extends beyond circle)
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 3,
    do_warp = TRUE, do_trunc = FALSE,
    seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "magma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()
```

## Color Palettes

```{r}
#| label: fig-hex-palettes
#| fig-align: center
make_hex_palette <- function(pal) {
  ggplot() +
    geom_puzzle_hex(
      aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
      rings = 3, seed = 42
    ) +
    scale_fill_viridis_c(option = pal, guide = "none") +
    coord_fixed() +
    theme_void() +
    labs(title = pal)
}

(make_hex_palette("viridis") + make_hex_palette("magma") + make_hex_palette("plasma")) /
(make_hex_palette("inferno") + make_hex_palette("cividis") + make_hex_palette("turbo"))
```

## Offset (Separation)

```{r}
#| label: fig-hex-offset
#| fig-align: center

make_hex_offset <- function(off) {
  ggplot() +
    geom_puzzle_hex(
      aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
      rings = 3,
      offset = off, seed = 42
    ) +
    scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "viridis", guide = "none") +
    coord_fixed() +
    theme_void() +
    labs(title = paste0("offset = ", off))
}

make_hex_offset(0) + make_hex_offset(5) + make_hex_offset(10) + make_hex_offset(15)
```

## Fusion Groups

Special keywords for hexagonal puzzles:

```{r}
#| label: fig-hex-fusion
#| layout-ncol: 2
#| fig-cap:
#|   - "center + ring1"
#|   - "All of ring2"
#| eval: false

# Center merged with ring 1
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 3,
    fusion_groups = "center-ring1",
    seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()

# Ring 2 pieces merged
ggplot() +
  geom_puzzle_hex(
    aes(fill = after_stat(piece_id)),
    rings = 3,
    fusion_groups = "ring2",
    seed = 42
  ) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "plasma", guide = "none") +
  coord_fixed() +
  theme_void()
```

## Parameters Reference

| Parameter | Type | Default | Description |
|-----------|------|---------|-------------|
| `rings` | integer | 3 | Number of concentric rings |
| `seed` | integer | random | Random seed for reproducibility |
| `offset` | numeric | 0 | Piece separation distance |
| `tabsize` | numeric | 20 | Tab size parameter |
| `jitter` | numeric | 4 | Randomness in tab shape |
| `do_warp` | logical | TRUE | Apply circular warping |
| `do_trunc` | logical | TRUE | Truncate to boundary |
| `fusion_groups` | string | NULL | PILES notation for fusing pieces |

## PILES Keywords

Special keywords available for hexagonal puzzles:

| Keyword | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| `center` | The center piece (piece 1) |
| `ring1` | All pieces in ring 1 |
| `ring2` | All pieces in ring 2 |
| `ringN` | All pieces in ring N |
| `boundary` | All outer boundary pieces |

## Code Example

```{r}
#| label: demo-hex-code
#| eval: false
library(jigsawR)

# Generate puzzle
result <- generate_puzzle(
  type = "hexagonal",
  grid = c(4),         # 4 rings
  size = c(250),       # 250mm diameter
  seed = 42,
  do_warp = TRUE,
  do_trunc = TRUE,
  offset = 5
)

# Save SVG
writeLines(result$svg_content, "hexagonal_puzzle.svg")

# Access piece info
cat("Generated", length(result$pieces), "pieces\n")
```
